sometimes, it makes me wonder,How I keep from going under,It's like a jungle sometimes, it makes me wonder,How I keep from going under,It's like a jungle sometimes, it makes me wonder,How I keep from going under,A child is born, with no state of mind,Blind to the ways of mankind,God is smiling on you, but he's frowning too,Because only God knows what you go through,You grow in the ghetto, living second rate,And your eyes will sing a song of deep hate,The place that you play and where you stay,Looks like one great big alley way,You'll admire all the number book takers,Thugs, pimps and pushers and the big money makers,Driving big cars, spending twenties and tens,And you wanna grow up to be just like them, huh,Smugglers, scramblers, burglars, gamblers,Pickpockets, peddlers and even
